decision_conditions: T2 (Works schedule) Ash - Reduce to 10m to retain as habitat
T374 Oak (Works schedule) - Reduce away from footpath to suitable healthy growth point. (Within W2 on TPO 24)

The existing crown / branch structure of the tree/s to be pollarded shall be removed, leaving a standing stem. The final cut/s shall be made in such a manner to promote the subsequent re-growth of a new crown.

The works shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained in BS3998: 2010 - "British Standard Recommendations for Tree Work". Climbing irons or 'spikes' shall not be used during the execution of this work.
Reason
In order to protect health of the tree and the visual amenity of the area.

No felling shall take place until such time as a scheme has been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority for a replacement tree(s), which shall be of 'Standard' size (about 2-3m high) and short-staked for support. The replacement tree shall be planted during the first planting season following the felling works hereby permitted. Thereafter, the replacement tree(s) shall be retained indefinitely and maintained (watered and weeded during the spring and summer) for 2-3 years, or until established.
REASON
In order to comply with the requirements of Section 206 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The length of the lateral limb(s) of the tree(s) to be pruned shall be tip-reduced as per the approved specification. This work shall comprise a reduction in the length of the limb(s) in a uniform and systematic manner and the limb(s) should be cut back to suitably positioned secondary branches.

The work shall result in a tree of typical form for the species and of balanced appearance. The level of limb reduction shall be expressed either as a percentage / length of the overall limb length to be removed, or as a level of clearance to be provided.

The works shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained in BS3998: 2010 - "British Standard Recommendations for Tree Work".  Climbing irons or 'spikes' shall not be used during the execution of the work.
Reason
In order to protect health of the tree and the visual amenity of the area.
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and dangerous/dead trees/ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Pruning:  Branches should be cut back to suitable growth points such as a side branch or outward facing bud.  The retained bud or branch ought to be at least one third of the diameter of the removed limb, to reduce the likelihood of dieback occuring and to maintain a flowing branch line.

Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.  Therefore, if applicable, it is advisable to consult your tree surgeon / consultant to agree an acceptable time for carrying out the approved works.

Expected standard of tree work: The approved works must be carried out in accordance with the conditions laid out above. If they are not, then enforcement action could being taken which could lead to prosecution and heavy fines. Therefore, it is highly recommended that the works are only carried out by a professional and competent arboriculturist who undertakes to comply with the conditions of this consent and in accordance with industry best practice (BS 3998:2010). The Arboricultural Association can provide details of its approved contractors, who have demonstrated such professionalism and competence, on their website (www.trees.org.uk) or by calling 01242 522152. Or on request the Council can provide a list of contractors who are known to carry out tree work to a good standard and to normally maintain an appropriate policy of indemnity insurance.
T363 Oak (Works schedule) - Fell to ground level  (Within G8 on TPO 24)
T349  Ash (Works schedule) - Fell to ground level. T363 Oak (Works schedule) - Fell to ground level  (Within G8 on TPO 24)
T378 Oak (Works schedule) -  Monolith to 10m and retain as habitat. (Within W2 on TPO 24)
Refusal of part of the requested works: The applicant retains a right of appeal against the part of the application that has effectively been refused:-
T363 Oak (Works schedule) - Fell to ground level  (Within G8 on TPO 24)
T349  Ash (Works schedule) - Fell to ground level. T363 Oak (Works schedule) - Fell to ground level  (Within G8 on TPO 24)
T378 Oak (Works schedule) -  Monolith to 10m and retain as habitat. (Within W2 on TPO 24)

With regard to the proposed felling of the over-mature Oak (T363) and leaning Ash (T349) and monolithing of another mature Oak tree (T378) - it is not considered that the reasons for these works are justified. The over mature Oak is one of the most prominent trees on site and is considered to have a moderate amenity value. The Ash tree also has a moderate amenity value. There is also no techincal evidence provided which justifies the removal of these trees. Both of these trees contribute to the visual amenity and arboreal character of the local area. The felling of the Oak tree more espsicially would have a sigificant impact on the visual amenity of the local landscape as this tree is in a prominent position on the site and is highly visible.

The monolithing of the other Oak tree (T378) is considered to be too drastic and is not considered to be justfied or necessary. The proposed work will also have a detrimental impact on the amenity value of this tree.
Conclusion: Having regard to
description: As per attached tree works schedule (W2 & G8 within TPO 24).
